articles.title: BNY builds “AI for everyone, everywhere” with OpenAI
articles.summary: BNY Mellon has partnered with OpenAI to make artificial intelligence more accessible, aiming to bring "AI for everyone, everywhere" through innovative solutions. This collaboration is expected to drive business growth and improve customer experiences. By leveraging OpenAI's technology, BNY Mellon can enhance its services and provide more efficient and personalized support to its clients.

articles.title: BBVA and OpenAI collaborate to transform global banking
articles.summary: BBVA has partnered with OpenAI to revolutionize global banking by integrating AI technology into its operations, aiming to enhance customer experience and improve internal processes. This collaboration is expected to drive innovation in areas such as chatbots, fraud detection, and personalized financial services. By leveraging OpenAI's cutting-edge technology, BBVA seeks to stay ahead of the curve in the rapidly evolving banking industry.

articles.title: How We Used Codex to Ship Sora for Android in 28 Days
articles.summary: The development team behind Sora leveraged Codex, a code generation tool, to rapidly deploy the app on Android in just 28 days. Codex enabled the team to automate coding tasks, significantly reducing development time and effort. This achievement showcases the potential of AI-powered coding tools like Codex to accelerate software development and deployment.

articles.title: Advancing science and math with GPT-5.2
articles.summary: Researchers have unveiled GPT-5.2, a powerful AI model that can assist with complex science and math problems, revolutionizing the way we approach these subjects. This innovative technology has the potential to accelerate scientific discoveries and make advanced math concepts more accessible. By leveraging GPT-5.2, scientists and students can tackle challenging problems with increased ease and accuracy, driving progress in various fields.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.2
articles.summary: The latest iteration of the GPT series, GPT-5.2, has been introduced, boasting improved language understanding and generation capabilities. This update is expected to enhance the model's ability to engage in more natural and informative conversations. With GPT-5.2, users can anticipate more accurate and human-like responses to their queries and prompts.

articles.title: Improved Gemini audio models for powerful voice experiences
articles.summary: Google has upgraded its Gemini audio models, enabling more accurate and efficient voice recognition for a range of applications. This improvement enhances the overall voice experience, allowing for better speech-to-text capabilities and more effective voice assistants. The updated models are expected to drive innovation in voice-activated technologies, making them more accessible and user-friendly.

articles.title: Deepening our partnership with the UK AI Security Institute
articles.summary: A leading tech company is strengthening its partnership with the UK AI Security Institute to advance AI security research and development. This collaboration aims to drive innovation in AI-powered security solutions, enhancing protection against emerging threats. The partnership is expected to yield cutting-edge technologies and expertise, bolstering the UK's position in the global AI security landscape.

articles.title: Strengthening our partnership with the UK government to support prosperity and security in the AI era
articles.summary: A major tech company has announced a strengthened partnership with the UK government to drive AI innovation and support national prosperity and security. This collaboration aims to harness AI's potential to boost economic growth, improve public services, and enhance cybersecurity. By working together, the UK government and the tech company seek to establish the country as a leader in responsible AI development and deployment.

articles.title: FACTS Benchmark Suite: Systematically evaluating the factuality of large language models
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced the FACTS Benchmark Suite, a comprehensive tool for evaluating the factuality of large language models, aiming to improve their accuracy and reliability. This suite assesses models' ability to distinguish between factual and non-factual information, a crucial step in enhancing their performance. By using FACTS, developers can identify and address factuality issues in their models, leading to more trustworthy AI systems.

articles.title: Engineering more resilient crops for a warming climate
articles.summary: Scientists are developing more resilient crops to withstand the challenges of a warming climate, using advanced engineering techniques to enhance their ability to thrive in extreme temperatures and weather conditions. This innovation has the potential to improve global food security and mitigate the impacts of climate change on agriculture. By creating climate-resilient crops, researchers aim to ensure a stable food supply for future generations.

articles.title: New in llama.cpp: Model Management
articles.summary: The latest update to llama.cpp introduces model management, allowing users to easily manage and switch between different AI models. This innovation enables more flexibility and customization, making it simpler to experiment with various models and applications. By streamlining model management, llama.cpp enhances the overall user experience and expands its potential use cases.

articles.title: Codex is Open Sourcing AI models
articles.summary: Codex, a cutting-edge AI technology, is open-sourcing its models, allowing developers to access and build upon its innovative language processing capabilities. This move is expected to accelerate AI research and development, enabling the creation of more sophisticated and customized AI applications. By making its models open-source, Codex is democratizing access to AI technology and fostering a community-driven approach to AI innovation.

articles.title: Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker: Cost-efficient Frontier Multimodal Performance
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker, a cost-efficient multimodal model that achieves frontier performance while reducing computational costs. This innovation enables more efficient processing of multiple data types, such as text, images, and audio, making it a significant breakthrough in AI development. By optimizing performance and cost, Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker has the potential to accelerate adoption of multimodal AI applications in various industries.

articles.title: Introducing swift-huggingface: The Complete Swift Client for Hugging Face
articles.summary: The Hugging Face team has introduced swift-huggingface, a comprehensive Swift client that allows developers to seamlessly integrate Hugging Face's AI models into their iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS apps. This innovation enables Swift developers to leverage the power of Hugging Face's transformer models for natural language processing and machine learning tasks. With swift-huggingface, developers can now build more intelligent and interactive apps with ease.

articles.title: DeepMath: A lightweight math reasoning Agent with smolagents
articles.summary: DeepMath is a cutting-edge, lightweight math reasoning agent that utilizes smolagents to solve complex mathematical problems. This innovative technology enables efficient and accurate reasoning, making it a significant breakthrough in the field of artificial intelligence. By leveraging smolagents, DeepMath has the potential to revolutionize math education and problem-solving applications.

articles.title: Benn Jordan's flock camera jammer will send you to jail in Florida now [video]
articles.summary: A device called the "Flock Camera Jammer" created by Benn Jordan, which can disrupt traffic cameras, is now illegal in Florida, and using it can result in jail time. This law aims to prevent drivers from evading traffic tickets by interfering with camera functionality. The new legislation highlights the ongoing cat-and-mouse game between tech-savvy individuals and law enforcement seeking to maintain public safety.

articles.title: Bit flips: How cosmic rays grounded a fleet of aircraft
articles.summary: A fascinating incident occurred where a fleet of aircraft was grounded due to "bit flips" caused by cosmic rays, which altered the planes' computer systems and triggered false error messages. This rare phenomenon highlights the vulnerability of modern technology to high-energy particles from space. The incident underscores the need for robust error correction and radiation hardening in critical systems, especially in the aviation industry.

articles.title: BpfJailer: eBPF Mandatory Access Control [pdf]
articles.summary: BpfJailer is a new Linux security system that utilizes eBPF (extended Berkeley Packet Filter) to enforce Mandatory Access Control (MAC), providing a more fine-grained and flexible approach to system security. This innovation allows for more precise control over system calls and resource access, enhancing overall security and reducing the risk of privilege escalation attacks. By leveraging eBPF, BpfJailer offers a more efficient and scalable solution for securing Linux systems.

articles.title: Show HN: Tripwire: A new anti evil maid defense
articles.summary: Tripwire is a new open-source defense mechanism designed to prevent "evil maid" attacks, where an attacker gains physical access to a device and installs malware. This innovative solution aims to detect and prevent such attacks by monitoring for any unauthorized changes to a device's boot process. By providing an additional layer of security, Tripwire helps protect sensitive data and devices from physical compromise.

articles.title: Guarding My Git Forge Against AI Scrapers
articles.summary: A developer has implemented measures to protect their open-source code on Git Forge from AI-powered scrapers that exploit public repositories for training data. The safeguards include rate limiting, CAPTCHAs, and API restrictions to prevent unauthorized access. This effort highlights the growing concern of protecting intellectual property in the era of AI-driven data harvesting.

articles.title: Koralm Railway
articles.summary: The Koralm Railway is a high-speed rail project in Austria that will connect the cities of Graz and Klagenfurt, reducing travel time to just 45 minutes. This innovative railway features advanced tunneling technology and will have a significant impact on regional transportation. Upon completion, it's expected to increase economic growth and connectivity in the region.

articles.title: Training LLMs for Honesty via Confessions
articles.summary: Researchers have proposed a novel approach to training large language models (LLMs) for honesty, where the model is encouraged to "confess" when it's unsure or doesn't know the answer to a question. This method aims to improve the model's transparency and trustworthiness by penalizing it for providing false or misleading information. By doing so, LLMs can become more reliable and accurate in their responses, reducing the spread of misinformation.

articles.title: Framework Raises DDR5 Memory Prices by 50% for DIY Laptops
articles.summary: Framework, a DIY laptop manufacturer, has increased the price of its DDR5 memory modules by 50% due to rising component costs. This price hike may impact the affordability of Framework's modular laptops, which are known for their customizable and upgradable design. The change reflects the broader industry trend of increasing memory prices, affecting the DIY laptop market.
